title: Is Jayson Tatum practicing with Celtics teammates? Latest social media post seems to indicate as much
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum practiced with the Celtics in San Francisco, indicating a possible return from his Achilles injury.
Celtics shared photos on Instagram showing Tatum scrimmaging with teammates, suggesting he might play soon.
Tatum's potential return is speculated around the Celtics vs. 76ers game on March 1 at TD Garden.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko delivered standout commentary for NBC during Team USA's gold win in women's hockey at Milan Cortina.
The NBC broadcast team of Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir highlighted Alysa Liu's figure skating gold with restrained commentary.
Providence led national TV viewership for the Super Bowl with a 51.2 rating, with Boston placing third and Seattle fifth.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free rides for Routes 23, 28, and 29 through June using unspent federal COVID-19 funds.
The free bus program, covering Mattapan, Dorchester, and Roxbury, costs approximately $340,000 per month to reimburse MBTA.
Boston officials and MBTA are discussing the program's future funding beyond June, considering its impact on local communities.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snowfall in Massachusetts with Leyden receiving 6.5 inches by Saturday morning.
Essex and Franklin counties experienced the most snow, with Haverhill in Essex receiving up to 5 inches.
A more significant storm with blizzard conditions and possible power outages is expected Sunday night into Monday.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa from Canton will run the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor victims of the 2013 bombing.
LaRosa, inspired by her coworker Annie who ran 24 marathons, aims to overcome personal challenges through the race.
The 2026 event on April 20 holds personal significance for LaRosa, marking her emotional and physical journey.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac sentenced to 15 months for wire fraud after misusing over $1 million in COVID relief funds.
Kirouac used $600,000 of the funds to purchase Angus Lea Golf Course in Hillsborough, violating fund guidelines.
He fraudulently secured Economic Injury Disaster Loans through the CARES Act for personal and business gain.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, faced charges in Boston Municipal Court for thefts at high-end Back Bay stores.
Cutelis allegedly stole items worth thousands from stores like Lululemon and Ralph Lauren, aided by surveillance footage.
Bail was set at $2,500 for Cutelis, who has a 25-year theft record and was held without bail for a New Hampshire charge.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony confirmed as Red Sox leadoff hitter for 2026 by manager Alex Cora.
Anthony had a .336 average and 1.003 OPS in leadoff role before injury ended his 2025 season.
Willson Contreras to bat cleanup; potential lineup includes Trevor Story, Jarren Duran, and Marcelo Mayer.

title: Margo Price talks AI, bro-country and meeting Joan Baez at the circus
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Margo Price discusses her inspirations, including Joan Baez, and her connections to Massachusetts before her Boston show.
Price's latest album 'Hard Headed Woman' draws influences from artists like Lucinda Williams and Bob Dylan.
Her husband Jeremy Ivey has a Boston connection from his past, which includes being homeless in the city briefly.

title: She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Jordan Whitaker is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Mass. Eye and Ear.
Whitaker's daughter received treatment at Mass. Eye and Ear for infected cysts and severe sleep apnea.
She aims to raise awareness for children's healthcare access through her marathon participation.
